lexUnit.name: growl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in a low grating voice.

sentence.text: ` I just hate it , " he growled , drooling between yellow teeth , ` when people misuse the suffix mega . "
` He 'd better bloody not , " Bragg growled .
` Fuck off , Richie , " he growled .
` Just stand back , " he growled , as he lifted himself painfully to his feet .
` If I had any sense , I 'd dump you overboard , " he growled .
` Listen carefully , signorina , " he growled , ` because I have no intention of saying any of this again .
` And you 've not had your throat cut yet , " growled Michael .
` They did that anyway , smartass , " growled Brown .
` Enough of that , " growled Freddy Ward .
` Move over , Rizzi , " growled a familiar voice .
He growled an apology , gave the poor girl a miserable parody of a smile and turned his attention to their patient .
Surkov growled his irritation , but Rozanov seemed to enjoy our floundering .
He growled something about my septic technique . "
` Put him in the car , " growled Brown when he had recovered his self-control .
He just growled something about having walked into a door . "
` Leave her to us , my lord , " growled a voice in Isabel 's ear .
He grew morose after that and growled at the customers , it seems -- so most took themselves to the next village for their ale .
` I bleedin' owe you for that one , " he growled at Joe .
He growled at the attendant , by now quite tipsy , and demanded another meal .
She had taken to growling menacingly at the more impressionable of the remedials to keep herself occupied .
` Who are you ? " he growled at the stranger .
` Get on with you then , do your laughing somewhere else , " he growled at them .
Put it back yourself if you like it round here , " he growled at Threlfall , and pushed the teacher up the steps .
The Maggot was growling to himself , relishing the confrontation .
` Nineteen eighty three , " he growled into the open firebox , ` would be the watershed ! "
` We 're dying of bloody thirst over ere , " Billy 's voice growled from the fireplace .
` Not in November , " Robert growled from the side table where he liked to carve the meat himself .
“ Out , ” the Maître d'Hôtel growled from by her ear .
Joe turned away from her , thrusting his hands deep into his overcoat pockets , and he sounded very like Martin himself as he growled out , ` Suppose , suppose , suppose .
Into yet another silence her father 's voice growled out , ` If he lives that long . "
If the boy had growled over his shoulder : ` Stand out of my light ! " the illusion would have been complete .
` Fabulous ! " he had growled sarcastically .
